frame.name: Being_named
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame concerns entities conventionally being referred to by particular names.
<ex><fex name="Entity">Her</fex> <t>name</t> <m>was</m> <fex name="Name">Lola</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Name</fen> identifies the linguistic expression used to refer to Entities.
<ex>My <t>name</t> is <fex name="Name">Bond</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Entity</fen> is the person the speaker intends to refer to by using a particular name.
<ex><fex name="Entity">You</fex> have an unusual <t>surname</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Language
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Language</fen> is used for a person or thing to whose name the <fen>Name</fen> of the <fen>Entity</fen> is taken or in honor of.
<ex><fex name="Lang">Spanish and Indian</fex> <t>names</t> were precedents to other non-English-sounding names.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Type</fen> denotes sub-type of names.
<ex>My <fex name="Type">given</fex> <t>name</t> used to be John.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>Describes the <fen>Name</fen> in some manner.
<ex><fex name="Entity">His</fex> <fex name="Descriptor">favorite</fex> <t>nickname</t> is <fex name="Name">'The Dark Knight'</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Context
FE.definition:
<def-root>The context is the region or domain in which the name applies.
<ex>The <fex name="con">Spanish</fex> <t>name</t> <fex name="Name">'Juan'</fex> begins with an English 'w'.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Etymological_root
FE.definition:
<def-root>The source language or inspiration for the Name.
<ex><fex name="Entity">His</fex> <t>name</t> <fex name="Context">in Spanish</fex> is <fex name="Name">'Santiago'</fex>, <fex name="ent">from the Latin</fex>.</ex> </def-root>
